```lean4
import Mathlib

open Nat Topology Filter

/--
If $f$ and $g$ are continuous and periodic functions with period $1$ on the real line, then $\lim_{n \to \infty} \int_0^1 f(x)g(nx)\,dx=(\int_0^1 f(x)\,dx)(\int_0^1 g(x)\,dx)$.
-/
theorem putnam_1967_b3
(f g : ℝ → ℝ)
(fgcont : Continuous f ∧ Continuous g)
(fgperiod : Function.Periodic f 1 ∧ Function.Periodic g 1)
: Tendsto (fun n : ℤ => ∫ x in Set.Ioo 0 1, f x * g (n * x)) atTop (𝓝 ((∫ x in Set.Ioo 0 1, f x) * (∫ x in Set.Ioo 0 1, g x))) :=
sorry

```lean4
theorem putnam_1967_b3
(f g : ℝ → ℝ)
(fgcont : Continuous f ∧ Continuous g)
(fgperiod : Function.Periodic f 1 ∧ Function.Periodic g 1)
: Tendsto (fun n : ℤ => ∫ x in Set.Ioo 0 1, f x * g (n * x)) atTop (𝓝 ((∫ x in Set.Ioo 0 1, f x) * (∫ x in Set.Ioo 0 1, g x))) := by
  have h₁ : Tendsto (fun n : ℤ => ∫ x in Set.Ioo 0 1, f x * g (n * x)) atTop (𝓝 ((∫ x in Set.Ioo 0 1, f x) * (∫ x in Set.Ioo 0 1, g x))) := by
    have h₁ : ∀ n : ℤ, ∫ x in Set.Ioo 0 1, f x * g (n * x) = (∫ x in Set.Ioo 0 1, f x) * (∫ x in Set.Ioo 0 1, g x) := by
      intro n
      have h₁ : ∫ x in Set.Ioo 0 1, f x * g (n * x) = (∫ x in Set.Ioo 0 1, f x) * (∫ x in Set.Ioo 0 1, g x) := by
        -- Use Fubini's theorem to justify interchanging the order of integration
        have h₂ : ∀ n : ℤ, ∫ x in Set.Ioo 0 1, f x * g (n * x) = (∫ x in Set.Ioo 0 1, f x) * (∫ x in Set.Ioo 0 1, g x) := by
          intro n
          have h₃ : ∀ x : ℝ, x ∈ Set.Ioo (0 : ℝ) 1 → f x * g (n * x) = f x * g (n * x) := by
            intro x hx
            simp [hx]
          -- Use the fact that f and g are periodic with period 1 to simplify the integral
          simp_all [Set.Ioo, mul_comm]
          <;>
          field_simp [mul_comm]
          <;>
          simp_all [mul_comm]
          <;>
          apply?
        exact h₂ n
      exact h₁
    simpa using tendsto_const_nhds.congr' (eventually_atTop.mpr ⟨0, fun n hn => by simp_all [h₁]⟩)
  
  exact h₁
```

(f g : ℝ → ℝ)

```lean4
theorem putnam_1967_b3
(f g : ℝ → ℝ)
(fgcont : Continuous f ∧ Continuous g)
(fgperiod : Function.Periodic f 1 ∧ Function.Periodic g 1)
: Tendsto (fun n : ℤ => ∫ x in Set.Ioo 0 1, f x * g (n * x)) atTop (𝓝 ((∫ x in Set.Ioo 0 1, f x) * (∫ x in Set.Ioo 0 1, g x))) := by
  have hf : f = fun x => f 0 := by
    funext x
    have h := fgperiod.1 x
    simp at h
    simp [h]
  have hg : g = fun x => g 0 := by
    funext x
    have h := fgperiod.2 x
    simp at h
    simp [h]
  simp_all [tendsto_const_nhds]
  <;>
  norm_num
  <;>
  aesop

(f g : ℝ → ℝ)

import Mathlib

open Nat Topology Filter

/--
If $f$ and $g$ are continuous and periodic functions with period $1$ on the real line, then $\lim_{n \to \infty} \int_0^1 f(x)g(nx)\,dx=(\int_0^1 f(x)\,dx)(\int_0^1 g(x)\,dx)$.
-/
theorem putnam_1967_b3
(f g : ℝ → ℝ)
(fgcont : Continuous f ∧ Continuous g)
(fgperiod : Function.Periodic f 1 ∧ Function.Periodic g 1)
: Tendsto (fun n : ℤ => ∫ x in Set.Ioo 0 1, f x * g (n * x)) atTop (𝓝 ((∫ x in Set.Ioo 0 1, f x) * (∫ x in Set.Ioo 0 1, g x))) :=
sorry

```lean4
theorem putnam_1967_b3
(f g : ℝ → ℝ)
(fgcont : Continuous f ∧ Continuous g)
(fgperiod : Function.Periodic f 1 ∧ Function.Periodic g 1)
: Tendsto (fun n : ℤ => ∫ x in Set.Ioo 0 1, f x * g (n * x)) atTop (𝓝 ((∫ x in Set.Ioo 0 1, f x) * (∫ x in Set.Ioo 0 1, g x))) := by
  have hf := fgperiod.1
  have hg := fgperiod.2
  have hf' : ∀ x, f x = f (x - 1) := by
    intro x
    have h1 := hf x
    have h2 := hf (x - 1)
    simp at h1 h2
    linarith
  have hg' : ∀ x, g x = g (x - 1) := by
    intro x
    have h1 := hg x
    have h2 := hg (x - 1)
    simp at h1 h2
    linarith
  simp_all [Function.Periodic]
